text: Amazing burgers! I came here with 5 other foodies and we were very impressed with the freshness of beef and fries. We shared the frenchie and fungus humongous burgers. The meat is so tender and juicy. It's not greasy. The fries are cut fresh too! The restaurant was only open 6 days and I wanted to try something new and unique as far as burgers go, and this place earned all of our stars.

Just has a three egg omelet with toast and home fries 
Meal was a great deal for only 10.00 for breakfast 
Sharon our waitress was efficient and caring and made us feel welcome .
Would return for breakfast for sure !!!

The customer service was horrible and the food was only mediocre. My friend and I ordered a 21st Century Burger, an Oink Moo Squeal Burger, and an order of Bacon Cheese Fries and the total came out to about 45 dollars. That is pretty pricey considering that the burgers didn't even come with fries on the side like every other place normally does. 
The waiters did not once check up on us, but we saw that they checked on other tables multiple times. The only time the one waiter "checked up" on us was when she gave us the check and asked us how we were doing. By then, we were already done eating so there was no point in that. 
I used a Groupon for this meal, so I showed them the code on my phone. One of the workers took my phone with her for about 10 minutes and walked around the whole restaurant back and forth with it. That was unnecessary when she could've easily used a pen and pad and write down the code. I wanted to ask for my phone back multiple times but it seemed like she was purposely ignoring my table when I tried to ask for it back.
I would never ever come back to PrimeBurger again.

Went back there on my last trip to vegas, told them about my last experience and the server was extremely kind and understanding, he apologized and so did the owner/manager.
They notified me that the same chef from the last visit was no longer at the establishment ad promised me and my friends the best meal and boy did they deliver. I can now highly recommend this place to any burger lover with full confidence. Thank you.
Amazing burger. For sure the best burger in town. Been there allredy twice. Realy good and professional service. Soft bun and all fresh ingredients. Not expensive at all.

This review is for the brand new Prime Burger at the Venetian. I believe this is the 2nd weekend its been open. For 4 burgers, 2 shakes, 3 salads = $120 without tip. 

The 4 members of my party went out for burgers on a Saturday night. Shortly after 7, we arrived to small half empty dining room. The atmosphere reminds of an Italian cafe - I thought it didnt fit the burger concept.  The tables and chairs are made of wood. In the back of the restaurant stands an open kitchen - so there is not much of a back of the house. 

The menu offers about 6 burgers and a number of sandwiches. There are a few salad options to cater to the vegetarians as well. The menu offerings remind of another burger place in Vegas called Holsteins. They offer similar burger combinations and boozy milkshakes. The menu states that burgers are made of prime rib meat and chuck and those products are ground in house. 

For this visit, the service was great. We had 2-3 individuals servicing the table. 
Our milkshakes and salads arrived first. The Caesar Salad was not spectacular but it was of great size. The price was $6. The salad was soggy with the amount of dressing it came pre tossed in. The croutons were typical store bought. I wouldn't order it next time. The Kale Thai Peanut salad looked ok. 

I ordered the 21st century burger. Average at best. The burger patty temp was hot and prepared as requested. It looks they cook their burgers on a flat tap which typically leaves them much greasier in my opinion.  I order the artisan Brioche bun. The flavor of the burger was ok just very greasy. 

We also ordered an onion ring tower - $9 WAY overpriced but it was good. It comes with about 6 HUGE onion rings and dipping sauces. I thought the rings were OK - standard - but did feel that price was too high. 

I gave this place 2 stars. There are a TON of burger places on the strip. I have been to about a dozen of them. This place doesn't quite compare to others on the strip. The price is expensive for what you get and the quality at some of the places is far better. This restaurant also lacks atmosphere.  The staff is here is very friendly and attentive however.

I've been sitting here for over an hour with three people that are speaking in their own language. We are sitting here with empty beer bottles, finished food plates, and empty water glasses. I was late joining my group and we tried flagging the server down so I could look at a menu and she just dropped off the check. Someone else figured out I needed a menu when I announced it loudly and mildly rudely. I haven't seen this server smile one time at any table she's served, but I have seen her approach her other tables to ask and refill water. I don't even know her name but all I know is her attitude is horrible. It put me off from ordering, but I finally caved in and had the onion rings. They were heavily breaded but tasted good. They were skimpy on the dipping sauce but I'm sure if I had another server I could have gotten more sauce. 

I'm typing this in the restaurant, waiting for my check for the onion rings.

This place has great breakfast! We went back 3 times and slowly worked our way through the menu. The service and quality of the food was phenomenal! We had our server, Elizabeth twice times and she was very helpful and upbeat. The food came out quickly and was AMAZING will definitely be returning the next time we're in Vegas!

This is a good basic hamburger joint. Ordered the Cali Club, my husband ordered the Hawaiian. The Club was good, crisp bacon, avocado, all of the essentials. My husband thought his burger should have been more grilled- no crust or grill flavor on the outside. In hindsight I agree, but the patty had decent flavor. The regular fries are plentiful and delicious. Overall, if you are hungry and need a reliable good, quick bite this place is solid. I would go back.

The burgers were very delicious, we had the 21st century and the fungus one out of suggestion from our server Iliana, she also suggested we shared our fries, which we greatly appreciated because the portion was enough for my girlfriend and I. She was was very attentive and had a great attitude. The whole atmosphere of the place is very relaxed and chill. The manager I think from his dress, Aubrey checked on us, as well as other tables and was very helping to his staff. Definitely recommend it!

Just ate waffle with starberries had to wait five min while friend ate his breakfast.mine came was hard waffle and cold they offerd free breakfast for me. But when i asked about eating dinner for free they said no just free waffle so no i will not come back. Thanks don

My friends and family visit prime burger at the Venetian every time we're in Las Vegas this little place is amazing the crafted food is delicious the service is tops Sharon is our go to gal. We look forward to seeing her as well as enjoying the amazing food.

Best burger I have ever tasted and the cheese fries smothered in bacon was awesome but be ready to share. Huge portion. My only regret is that I didn't try the alcoholic milkshakes but next time I'm in vegas I'll definitely be back !!!!!!  If your in vegas on vacation you have to try PRIME BURGER! !!!

Horrible Horrible Horrible! The food was meh.. but the service was a joke. I ordered the Frenchie and expected a nice runny egg and instead i got a hard boiled egg on top. I requested another egg and it was just as ridiculously over cooked. The waiter said ohwell and the manager was too busy apologizing to another table that she didn't even look at us.  The 2 shakes took about 30 min because the new bartender didn't know how to make them and had 2 wait for the manager and our waiter had to show him how to make a margarita also. Restaurant was Not packed and everyone who was there was pissed or just got up and left. I'm still mad about spending $150 here.. your better off going to B&B or IBurger.. even the food court is a better option!

Was at this little upscale burger place last night with a few friends. Wow!...the banana shake AMAZING!...burger very juicy and tasty!...not greasy...their variety is very creative. Rhonda was our waitress she's was just as nice!

I don't know where to start..... First of all everyone that work there were very friendly and were patient to go over the menu with us. the bacon and cheese fries were off the hook with a secret dipping sauce that had a little kick but not over powering, the milk shakes was also delicious!! Now the burgers were off the hook. I couldn't even finish my burger because it was so big!! We will definitely be returning to try something else on their menu!! 5 start across the board!!
I got the Cali Club burger. It was an average burger, nothing special. They also overcharged my credit card.

Amazing!!!! Hamburgers were great! So delicious! I had the oink oink burger i devoured that thing! We also had an infused shake with alcohol delish! Our server, Iliana was the sweetest and just gave us excellent customer service. (I feel bad for how many times i asked for one thing after the other but not once sid she have attitude always a smile ) I love food i love trying out new places and today we were feeling hamburger-ish def. Glad we came here. The location is great, Iliana was amazing, and the food delicious! The only thing i probably will say needs improvement is the hostess should smile and make the guest feel more comfortable. But overall i loved it!

This is by far the best burger joint in Vegas. Iliana, stephany, Aubrey, and Jared were so accommodating and so friendly. Service was a 20/10. I am AMAZED by the service. Iliana was out waitress and was the friendliest and most understanding waitress in the world.

So good! The burgers were cooked well, tasty and unique. I had the kale peanut salad and I'm craving it again two days later. To top it all off, they had alcoholic ice cream shakes which were to die for! Try the Baileys oreo banana shake. Service was good.

Looks super low key from the outside but amazing food. We came for breakfast and were incredibly impressed. Breakfast sandwich was one of the best i have ever had! Would definitely come back. French toast was also good. Service was great as well.

The prime burger is neat and clean. Has great decode and the waiter we had (Andres) was very nice and helpful.8 would recommend prime burger. I didn't give it five stars because there was a little mishap. The fries and burger were delicious and perfectly  cooked to perfection. I would come here all the time. LOVE IT

Good burgers, cheap beer and free fries when you check in! It's located in the Venetian food court and great for a quick bite. The fries are huge and 3 people can share them. It is decently priced and I would def go there again when in the Venetian.

Just wanting everyone to know this is the best burger place in Las Vegas. I go Las Vegas at least once a month and go there for breakfast everyday I'm in town I have our favorite waitress and her name is SHARON. She is great and I think sometimes I go just to see her. She has always given us the best service ever. I have sent many of our friends there and she always waits on them with her smiley face and personality. We will be back in to weeks to see here again. Oh and the breakfast is great to, but without her we would have to find another place to eat. 

I'm rewriting my new review because I will never eat  at Prime Burger again, I loved going to that place the staff and management is great, but very understaffed No hostess or bussers and the GM ID THE DISH WASHER. REALLY,  I go every month to visit SHARON we come from the Napa Valley my son works for the hotel and there in there weekly to see her. You will loose money with crappy groupon's. If that's the type of people you want there you will go broke. After finding out she was no longer there we will never be back. The food was Good was ok but the service was great. We will find SHARON else where.

2.45? 

Decent. Only worth it if you're nearby, can't decide what to eat, and you happen to have a groupon for it. Don't get anything but the burgers here. If you get the tuna, you'll be sorry.

A bit disappointing. wait staff was very slow and there was hardly anyone in the restaurant. the burgers were smaller than I expected -- they looked too much like a patti melt and less like a beefy burger. I had the scorcher which was billed as hot, but there was so much flavor from jalepenos and sauce, I could not taste the burger

Thank goodness the food was amazing, because it made up for the server being a complete B! Her name was Sharon! From pretty much saying she will get to us when she gets to us to placing a plate on the table and telling us to figure it out, oh lets not forget when asking for a refill she seriously huffed! Oh I asked for a plate for the appetizer, and she told me I wouldn't want all these plates on the table umm I dont thinking I was asking permission to have a plate, because you didnt want to go get it. There is so much more to her being a horrible server. The manager was okay about the situation, but think he could of been a bit more understanding! Would def. eat there again, but if i saw she was working I may change my mind.

Not a bad burger joint for a mall.  However, I cannot certify any self-proclaimed burger joint that does not serve fresh cut fries.

I had the bacon egg and cheeseburger.  The fried egg was different, but was a nice touch. It added another level of texture that I did not expect. I did miss the fresh crispy veggies normally found on a bacon cheeseburger, so this burger really turned out quite soggy and bland.

The price is definitely too high for the quality...
Quite expensive for a very average burger - I expected a great juicy burger but got a dry patty.  Would go elsewhere.
We had a really nice meal yesterday - relaxing, more than enough to eat and friendly service.  Portions are very generous - and tasty.

From the moment we walked in this restaurant, the staff was super attentive, and helpful. We actually purchased a Groupon while checking out the menu...and nobody gave us any attitude about the Groupon. 
Melody, our server, was incredible! She even allowed us to switch tables so we could view the football game on their single tv available. And she returned many, MANY times to refill our iced teas.
We order a ceaser salad and sweet potato fries, and the Americana burger, cooked medium, to split. The burger was cooked perfectly, and deliciously juicy. It was super messy, but worth every bite! And the sweet potato fries were some of the best I ever had; it may have been the sweet dash of sugar on them!
We would definitely recommend this place & come back for more!
This place sucks. Sharon our server could give two sh*** about anything. Ordered an appetizer that came as desert. Staff not friendly at all. Even the manager had no clue.

Being a Vegatarian in Las Vegas can be hard. And pleasing a chefs wife even harder.

Last night we went to see my visiting parents at the Venitian and we were all hungry so decided to go to the food court to please everyone's different palet.

After looking at the different menu options I decided on a bocca burger and fresh cut fries at Prime Grill.

While I was waiting at the bar for my to go order, I heard a a sound of something dropping on the floor and quicky looked right as the line cook put  something back on the edge of the grill . 

A little worried I asked nice woman behind the bar what dropped. I couldn't tell if it was the burger press or the spatula. The lady said it was the burger press.
,i was shocked .. 

The line cook or chef didn't even put it away to be washed. She put it back on the edge of the grill. 

So I stated , do you know that fell and your cook put it back, she said yes , it happens , not allot but it does , so I said . you know it is a health hazard. I said I have worked in the kitchen and owned my own restaurant and my husband is a chef . and that is unacceptable.
About 5 minutes later she moved it it away . 

But as I was eating my food I kept thinking , what if the spatula fell on the ground  or my food , would they just out that back on the grill ?? 

If I had not of said anything and complained would they of replaced it at all ??,

UPDATE ..

THE owner Robb , personally repaonded to my post and was exrremely nice .. And went over board in his apology. VERY RARE , for a owner to respond.

I am impreased ..

Nice little joint for a quick bite with OK burgers, nothing amazing or bad to say. The price is on the $$$ side rather than $$ as listed on yelp. The ambiance is very open and not intimate.  Found an eyelash on my order, the restaurant was right on on recovery, verbally apologized, quickly replaced the order and finalized the service by once again apologizing this time around serving us dessert on the house.
The service is so amazing they're so kind! I love the fries and the burgers are so delcious and fresh!! Definitely recommend:)

Good service, good food. The Hawaii Five Oh was a nice change from a regular burger.  The chocolate shake was hand made. Throw in The Yelps Link for  free fries & 1/2 price beer tonight - we had an enjoyable meal.

we came here and it was empty last night, about 8pm, Monday night. 
still got seated, even though an empty restaurant is not a good sign.

BEST BURGER EVER!

The meat, while a somewhat more thin patty than you might expect (not a filet mignon beast for sure) was so freaking tasty. Funny, no one there knows where it comes from, but they say it's never been frozen. Anyway, truly, best tasting burger I've ever had.

We came back for breakfast. FANTASTIC breakfast and CHEAP too! 

This place is what Vegas used to mean... super good eats for cheap.

Do come here, you will NOT be disappointed.

We were at Prime Burger for the first time yesterday afternoon.. The burgers are really good.. I was very impressed with the service. We had a really nice lady by the name of Sharon.. Very attentive always had a smile on her face. We will definitely be back on our next visit. This is my first to Yelp. It is very well deserved
Ordered 2 burgers between 2 friends and both feel apart.  The buffalo fries were terrible. Don't get them. Although it's cheap for Vegas prices, it's not worth it. Better off going to In-N-Out.

Get the 'Oink, Squeal, Moo!'  I don't think I've ever had a better burger.  Milkshakes, fries, and drinks were top notch too. Seriously, this place is cheap, quick, and conveniently located.  I'll be coming back.

We had this our last night in Vegas and it was a great decision. We were totally over food at this point, so their huge burger and portions were great to split. 

The party was tasty, though slightly over cooked since they couldn't do Medium Well, but its flavor was outstanding. 

The waiters were friendly and fast. 

The shakes are worth the visit even at $15/ each. 

We sat outside overlooking the gondola rides and Volcano across the street. If it's cool enough, this certainly enhances the experience.

Located in the beautiful Venetian hotel...another burger place to try and I'm glad I did.

The place is small, but if you go at an off time, it's easy to get a seat. Be sure to check in on Yelp and get your free fries. I asked to have them extra crispy and they were just like I wanted them, with just the right amount of salt.

I ordered a burger with avocado and bacon. The burger was cooked medium rare just like I asked, perfectly seasoned,  tender and juicy.  The onion rings are huge and a little too bready for me, however, the onions were sweet and delicious.  

We got the brownie with ice cream drizzled with chocolate fudge for dessert.  It comes with 2 squares and a nice serving of whipped cream. It's so yummy and large enough to share!

The place is clean and the service was friendly and quick. I will be back...I want to try one of the shakes next time. They look delicious and huge as the people sitting next to us got a couple to try.

(Actually 3 1/2 stars, extra 1/2 for the service)...I ordered my burger well done and it was dry and overpriced for the size; prior to the Groupon discount. I got the regular fresh cut fries with my Yelp check-in.  This is something I would've expected had I ordered a turkey, lamb, or bison burger, which are typically leaner meats and are best served medium or medium well. The burger being so dry was a let down.  I LOVE fresh cut fries, but these were a way too thin for me. I also ordered a non alcoholic vanilla shake and it was awesome!! I may give them another try if near that end of the Vegas strip and don't a coupon, but I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to come here again. Sorry... I'll add that Justin was an excellent server and I love the unique ceiling fans.

This place did not disappoint!  The burgers were fresh and of high quality ingredients well worth the wait.  The staff was very polite and made sure everything was just as ordered. The burger I had was should've been for two as I could only eat half which made for a nice survival kit for later.  Until next time.

Went in for a quick late lunch while we were wandering the strip checking out Christmas decorations and had medium to low expectations. We were seated quickly despite them being busy, and our waitress was quick to bring menus and our drinks. I had the Hawaii Five Ohhhh burger and my husband had the Big Scorcher. He also ordered the bacon and cheese fries - to me, they tasted like a loaded baked potato, minus the sour cream. They were good, but I stayed focused on the burger.  The brioche bun, the tender and tasty beef with just the right amount of sweetness from the pineapple against the onion and teriyaki totally worked. The Big Scorcher didn't disappoint either, it was cooked to my husband's requested medium rare and had the right amount of heat. We live local and don't head down to the strip often, but i'd absolutely go back if we're in the area.

Figured we would give primeburger a try. Was not expecting a lot. Man I was wrong. Completely blew our expectations We came back 3 times while we were staying in Vegas. They do honor the Yelp check in!!!!

Me and my friends were looking for a cheaper burger spot. Just a good lo key place.  Something different. I researched some places for burgers in the Venetian. Primeburger came up. Said burgers with a twist. Figured why not I'll give it a try. The best way to describe prime burger is reasonable prices food! But higher end look and taste. Burgers were from $12-20 depending on the model. 

We called to make reservations. The girl on the phone said we can just come in. If you have not been to the Venetian. Getting to primeburger is like a maze. Soo confusing. Def worth the walk tho. When we arrived there was one table left. Our waiter was very nice. Had a convo with us. The first night we ordered burgers. Before we recieved our burgers. We ordered the app of loaded pulled pork nachos. The pulled pork is sooo good here. They fresh fried the chips. All of us could have ordered the nachos for a meal. Sooo good. 

But the burgers. Wow. I usually go to Holsteins at the cosmo for burgers when I'm in Vegas. So it was not expecting much  My friend ordered the BBQ. This thing was crazy. It had a burger. Pulled pork. brisket. Bacon. Grilled onions and was loaded with BBQ. For $18. My friend only ate half. It was big. I ordered the burger with kale and bacon jam. I ordered it med. the kale was very nice. But the burger was juice Central!!! Sooo juicy. Melted in your mouth juicy. Cooked really good fresh ingredients. They have spiked milkshakes. We just drank water. We had been so thirsty all day. 

Overall. Primeburger blew my expectations. Sooo good. We are here 3 times. It was good. I will def be back here next time I'm in Vegas. I recommend anyone to come here. If you are looking for a solid meal that does not break the bank. 

PROS:
- friendly staff
- free fries with Yelp check in 
- cost effective 

CONS:
- hard to find location. Venetian is a huge confusing hotel

A prime location in the Grand Canal Shoppes isn't everything, you have to deliver with the food and service.

Rosa, the hostess, was excellent. Fun, friendly, and helping out the servers whenever she could. Unfortunately it wasn't enough--our server disappeared after taking our order and I only saw him back in the kitchen for the rest of the night. Suddenly Shannon was our server, without explanation. She did what she could, but the handoff was unexplained.

During this handoff, much of my order was bungled. The garnishment for my drink didn't make it to the table and my brioche bun became whole wheat. While not what I ordered, no one came to check on me for a length of time so I just ate it.

In terms of the food itself, my Italiano burger was ok. I was warned in advance that the mozzarella and marinara would come cold but I went with it and did enjoy it. Sadly the prosciutto was very fatty--some of it was almost inedible. Despite that the aforementioned whole wheat bread was better than expected, though for $15, they really should have included some fries.
Horrible service, don't acknowledge you for a long time.  I walked out along with my team and corporate credit card

Prime burger finally opened!! The first thing I tried (strangely enough) was there nachos!! Now for a burger joint these nachos were quite different they were good ,but they weren't mind blowing. I would change the cheese from cheddar to nacho.

Come in with low expectations.  We got 2 burgers, a salad and two adult milkshakes.  When they seated us the threw the menus on a table and walked away, we had no idea if they were cleaning a table.or what so we waited.  They tried to take our order as we sat down and it took forever for the waitress to come back.  We watched our food sit on the warmer and it was bland.  They kept messing up our orders.  I was a server and they only had 3 tables, how do you make these mistakes with 3 tables.  

I'd avoid this place and go to the food court next to it...

Hot damn these burgers are serious! After a long flight, I just had to get the "Oink, Squeal and Moo" to satisfy my carnivorous state. It was a good choice.

Fries are cut in house and on point. Glad I came here for my first meal in Vegas!

Just when I thought there could be no better burger I found the absolute best burger . 
Every toppings, well built , generous portions , tasty milkshakes and great service ...  
Reasonably priced liked their $19.95 steak dinner ... A absolute must ... 


Update to our first review : 
With so many burger places to choose from , Prime Burger is way above the norm .
You can literally taste the freshness with every bite . The beef is succulent and juicy , the bun is soft but not chewy and the milk shakes should be called liquid gold . 
My goodness what a great find in a city of everyone trying to put out do everyone else,  the burger  stops here .

Delicious burgers! They melt in your mouth. I got the three meat burger, my husband got the Italian. He wasn't a fan of his, the flavors didn't mesh, but mine was amazing! Sweet potatoes fries and regular fries are a ten!

This was a really tasty burger! They were flavorful and juicy, and the service here was really great. I'll admit, I was so hungry that I just went with a basic bacon cheeseburger, instead of something more interesting, but I enjoyed it a lot.

We will certainly return next time we're in town.

Service was great.  Got some free fries with Yelp check in. The fries were a little soggy  The fries had no seasoning, but maybe that is how they serve their fries?  The burger was good, cooked to order not a great burger but good enough for a quick meal before a show. The Coronas were great. We stopped here as it was not packed with people and thought it would be quick and easy. Which it was. When we left it was full of people.

Best burger I have ever had! I ordered the Frenchie and the flavor combo on this burger was so perfect. I don't remember which burger my husband got, but he's a picky guy and he really liked his too. The fries were also great.  My husband got apple pie with fresh whipped cream for dessert, and I'm assuming he loved it, cause it was gone in minutes . I gotta chocolate milkshake and it was really good, like the ones you would make at home. Oh by the way, they also make adult alcoholic milkshakes....they sounded so good, but it was a bit early for drinking. We will be return customers on our next visit to Vegas.

Came here because of a Groupon I had purchased. The hostess was courteous and our waiter was very attentive. He took the time to explain the different burger options, including his personal favorite. The restaurant was also very clean and well kept. As far the burger, the meat was a bit bland but ketchup did the job. Overall very filling and satisfying.

Go see Angel!! This place is a gem! We stumbled across this place but we'll be back again!! Angel was such a wonderful waiter so friendly, great smile and excellent customer service! The prime rib was excellent the wine and beer were half off!  Just go!!!! Thank you Angel!!!

More like sub-prime burger. Okay, that might be a little harsh, considering I didn't have the service issues that seem so prevalent in other reviews, but it was hard to find anything great about my burger. I got the Frenchie (gruyere, swiss, fried egg, onion relish, grilled onions, frisee, dijon mayo, $15) and it was rather plain tasting- burger was closer to medium than med-rare, I wasn't asked my bun preference (brioche for the French burger should be a given), and there was no wow factor. The dijon-mayo and onion relish were nearly nonexistent, burger had a very one-note flavor profile. When a burger is $15, it should at least be perfectly executed even if the toppings dont work well together.  On the plus side, they have a Yelp check-in offer for free fries ($4.50 value)- they're thin cut, crispy, and salty, and portion is large enough for the table to share.

If you are in Las Vegas and looking for good burger. Primeburger will not disappoint you. Their burgers are huge with a really meaty burger patties. The service is friendly and make you like you have been there before.

Very reasonably priced breakfast in this small open diner.  I had the special with eggs, bacon, potatoes, and toast for $11, while my partner had the Spinach and Mushroom 3-egg Omelet for $12. My son had French Toast for $10 but I wouldn't recommend that.  After we ate we got a coupon to use if we came back. That made the prices even more reasonable on the overpriced Las Vegas strip.

Really expensive but the burgers are super amazing! Quality meat and ingredients. When you order a burger fries are not included and drinks are pricy too. Plus side is customer service is great except for the hostess it wouldn't hurt her to smile or at least half a** it.

Hangover spot? Yes.  Gourmet but quick to serve spot? Yes. Busy prime spot? Yes.

I was definitely craving for some juicy burger with flavored buns.  Well Prime Burger did its work and hit my craving spot.

I ordered the Century Burger and devoured it. Since I checked in with yelp, they offered complimentary fries with your burger.  The fries are nice, crispy, and tasty.  I wasn't able to finish off the fries but I definitely brought it back to my room and finished it for later.

If I'm in the Venetian hotel, I'll be coming back to this burger joint.

They were really kind to serve coffees many  times and gave us free French fries as Yelp gift during breakfast period even though it was not a actual serving period. We enjoyed eating our breakfast with kind and comfortable services.

Your typical gourmet burger joint in Vegas: overpriced. Located inside the Venetian Grand Canal Shoppes, they say they are owned by the same folks as Johnny Rockets and use "fresh prime Angus beef that's never frozen." Do I buy that or not...who knows?

FYI, The menu is not very combo-friendly. An order of a burger does not come with any fries. You have to order the fries separately as the burger only comes with a pickle slice and a small cherry tomato).

Anyways, I got the Cali Club burger on a brioche bun and I'd have to say I've definitely had better "boutique" burgers before. The burger was very dry and didn't have that special sauce that typically accompanies burgers. Maybe I overrated having an avocado in my burger. Sounds better on paper than it tastes. I had a bite of my friend's 21st Century burger and it was much better. The fried egg in the 21st Century gave it a distinct and unique taste that was quite delicious.

We got orders of fresh-cut fries ($4.50) and a tower of onion rings ($9). I was not a fan of the fries. If you like small and skinny fries, this is something you'll love. However, I was a fan of the onion rings...really big and crispy. Goes great with ranch. If you're a fan of spicy, you can even ask for spicy ranch.

The service was pretty bad. Yes, they have only been open for a few months but the servers did not know what they were doing. She messed up our drink order and our food took FOREVER to come out.  That might be an understatement. Not to mention, it all came out at different times. 1 burger came out, then an order of the fries, then another burger, then the onion rings, etc...Whatever request we had for our waitress, we had to ask multiple times...

Tough gourmet burger crowd in Vegas nowadays. With the price I paid, I'd rather go to Gordon Ramsey's BurGR or even Shake Shack. You definitely pay a high price for convenience.

based on yelpers I saw the 4 star mark and wanted to sample their burgers, for lunch why not with some co-workers before heading home from a long week of deployment of idevices, better to be outside then locked in a meeting room for 12-14 hours a day. Also came here in part to sober up from the night before drinking festivities haha

was it greasy surprisingly no, was it heavy HELL YES, was it Delicious, oh man I will be back, mind you I was no longer drunk when we came in to eat, 

I sampled these dishes from there full menu, the bacon cheese fries, they were more overkill in my opinion but then again you are in vegas so it has to be overkill right... portion wise if fed 4 of us fine, for the burger I had the egg, bacon cheese burger how can you deny the simple options, the pork burger looked and smelled delicious. I was happy with the portion of their burger, taste, overall burger was made just right, patty was medium well, bun held all the juices of the meat in, egg was a bonus, bacon was a double bonus

If your looking for a burger definitely a spot I recommend, all burgers that came out looked and smelled appetizing

Food **** burger are a yes, ** bacon cheese fries are an overkill don't do it
Price $$
Service **** smiles, helpful, not a dark restaurant you can actually see your food
Ambiance *** small venue but it works, nothing special some tables that fit 4 some less
Restaurant was relatively empty so we were seated quickly and our server was over shortly after. Food was average, burgers were good but not great.

Wow...I wish I could give Primeburger more than 5 stars. It is the bomb!!! My family and I are burger fanatics. So, when we were searching near the Grand Canal Shoppes at The Venetian for a restaurant and came across Primeburger we had to stop and give it a try.

The BEST BURGERS we have ever had. First of all, it took us 20 minutes to to choose which gourmet burger we each wanted. Such a great selection.They all sounded so good and different than any other burger we had tried before. We all selected different burgers and shared them. They were all incredible! You could really tell that they were made with quality, prime ingredients.

And that's just the burgers. We had three appetizers: Barbecue Nachos, Onion Rings & Chicken Wings. We loved everything! But, we were not done, we also each got a handmade shake. Best of all for the adults, they have shakes with alcohol. I had the Kahlua Mudslide. It rocked. 

You have so many restaurants to choose from in Vegas. Unfortunately, my family and I found several that were simply low quality tourists traps. Primeburger however delivers with incredible food and even great service.

We will be back to Primeburger!

Burgers were tasty and decently priced. However, they were incredibly messy to eat and fell apart. I think that the bun was probably too cold and thus not flexible, so it immediately crumbled into several pieces when we attempted to cut the burger in two. Also, my burger was unevenly cooked. Well done on one side and medium rare on the other. Not a huge deal, but kind of strange. 


Our waiter was great and attentive, but I noticed another waiter standing around talking and drinking his pink Gatorade on the floor. He often let his customer's food sitting on the counter for several minutes before he took it out to them. Sure glad he wasn't our waiter!  

All said and done though, I wouldn't mind going back.

Our server Iliana was very attentive and sweet! We had Oink pull-pork burgers without the Mayo. Mine was well done and I was happy that I made the right decision; the beef patty was yummy with a little bit of charcoaled crisp but the sauce for the pull pork was too sweet for my taste.
We will definitely visit again.
Our burgers were wonderful and served with a smile. Cooked exactly as we ordered. Would come back for sure

3 stars because with every bite I had to spit out the hard pieces out of the meat which felt like cork screws. Seems like who ever put the beef through the grinder put everything in there. Will post pictures

Wow! Yum! DELISH! Andres, our waiter, was SIMPLY THE BEST! He was upbeat, friendly, and provided Stellar customer service. Our waters were always full and he periodically checked in with us. The burger was AMAZING! Fresh, DELICIOUS, and AMAZING. Onion rings were the best I have ever had! Beer...always a perfect match with a burger. The free fries after checking in were a great addition and tasted DELICIOUS too.

Came to prime burger for Sunday morning breakfast prior to football.  Very well done eggs and pancakes .  Reasonably priced and attentive service.  Tried the acai bowls and was pleasantly surprised.   Sharon was a great waitress and treated us really well. Overall a satisfying meal.

The food was phenomenal, and we got a great deal because we purchased two of their groupon certificates and used the free fries Yelp check-in. Their alcoholic milkshakes are superb!

Although I had a great meal, I'm giving Primeburger 4 stars because the hostess was not polite. We had a reservation, and our party arrived about 3-5 minutes late; however, the hostess lectured us on being tardy to a reservation - very uncalled for since the restaurant was not busy whatsoever. And I understand their concern, but did not appreciate her approach.

Small place inside the Grand Canal Shoppes at the Venetian. I had the basic burger, fries, and a soda. Burger was juicy and very tasty, price is comparable to other places in the Strip area. The fries were also very good however the $4.50 price was a little over the top. All total without tip my check was $20.55. 
The service at this place is horrible. I was only checked on once and I sat around for 15 minutes waiting for the check after I was finished with my meal. Another waitress saw me but I guess she didn't say anything to my waitress. Good thing I had enough cash on me to cover the bill because I am sure it would of been another 15 minutes or more to process my payment.
For the price you are paying I would like to think that the service would match.

I wanted a burger. I saw burger in the name and decided to try this spot.  I was greeted promptly but a guy who sat me down.  A lady, I think Christine, attended to me and took order.  Very nice, on point.  I ordered the Cali burger which was delicious!!!  I asked for the sweet potato fries.  They give u a sack of fries.  Share!!!!!  Only order 1 if 2 are in your party.  My hub ordered the American burger which he loved.  I checked in on here and they have a coupon for an order of free fries.  Check in as soon as u sit down.  Nice music, clean spot, love the decor.

It's a nice venue located in the food court of the Venetian Shopping Mall. It is a bit pricey, for the burger alone its around $13, and I think about $5 for a side of fries, I just got the burger since I wasn't too hungry. We ordered a alcoholic milkshake which was not bad, but at $14 it's not much booze at all in it. Overall, if you want a pricey burger joint then this is it. The server was nice and answered all our questions.

DELICIOUS! Ordered the cali burger and it had so much flavor. The meat was cooked exactly how I ordered it and our servicer Angel was great. My friend ordered the Hawaiian Five-O and said it was BOMB!

Located off of the food court area, this place needs better real estate in this casino. It's very casual, and affordable. The menus has a ton of options to choose from. There were a number of vegan options here- I came for the portobello mushroom burger then noticed they have a specialty vegan burger on the menu as well. A side of fries is extra!! Why? Because life isn't fair sometimes. There is a decent selection of beers, but nothing crazy. It was a good experience, and I would recommend for a quick, inexpensive meal.

This place screams calories.  When you done here you are lucky if you get out of there under 3000 calories.  Don't get me wrong, I love a great burger just like anyone else, but the fries, the onion rings and then of course the alcohol loaded shakes.  I got the 21st Century burger with grilled onions, bacon tomato relish, gruyere cheese, lettuce greens and a fried egg. The burger was ultra juicy and prepared just the way I like it, medium rare.  We tried the fries and they came out piping out, extra crispy and free with your Yelp check in. We also tried the panko crusted onion rings.  Very thick onion rings and the batter is on the thicker side as well. If you like a lighter, crispier onion ring like Fatburger, you may not enjoy these.  The onion rings are frozen and not made fresh, but overall still very tasty. We decided on the hot brownie with ice cream topped with fudge sauce and a dollop of whipped cream for the finale. The brownie was tasty, but definitely a lot of food.  The burger wasn't cheap at $15, but the quality was there.  i would return to try another burger down the road.

This spot is a little tricky to find, but offers great burgers. Had the Americana with no cheese, with a side of extra crispy sweet potato fries. The burger had soft, juicy meat that was ground in-house, cooked perfect to medium rare. Brioche bun was delicious and fresh too.

Fantastic burgers!! This was my husband and my first time here, and we are so glad we tried it! We always have a difficult time finding good, reasonably priced places to dine on the strip, but finding ourselves on the strip and overly-hungry at 8pm from not having had dinner yet, we decided to turn to Groupon to explore possible options, in hopes we wouldn't have to pay an arm and a leg to have a decent meal on the strip. We stumbled across a deal for PrimeBurger, and decided to give it a try. It was easy to find, and we were happy to see there was only one other couple dining there when we arrived, so we were able to get right in. The dining area is pretty small, but it doesn't feel cramped and they have booths and tables & chairs. The hostess greeted us with a smile and gave us the option of a booth or table (worth a point in my book). The atmosphere is nice and relaxing-a refreshing break from the loud hustle and bustle of the strip. Our waiter was super friendly and very attentive. We each ordered a burger with fries and were surprised with how quickly it was brought out. The burgers are good sized, and the fries portions are huge! Our burgers and fries were hot and very flavorful. I especially liked that the servers bring ketchup, mustard, and mayo bottles to the tables, as I like being able to choose how much of each I want on my burger. I also enjoy having mayo on my burger, but I don't like paying the extra charge most restaurants want for it. So this was great! Both my husband and I said our burger was the best burger we have ever had. When we presented our Groupon to our waiter, he smiled and told us it made him so happy to see we had a Groupon, as he now was beating another waiter in the amount of Groupons they processed that day. It was refreshing to see this, as usually when we present our Groupons, the servers look at it with disdain and begrudgingly take it to subtract from the bill, so we appreciated his good attitude about it. Friendly, attentive servers, a clean, quiet dining area, huge portions, and great tasting burgers- we will definitely be back!

Went here for lunch to grab a quick bite. The service was super friendly and fast. We got the buffalo wings which were pretty good. The heat of them kinda sneaks up on you. I got the bacon, egg and cheese burger which was fantastic. Everything cooked to perfection. My fiance had the Italiano burger which he said was really good. We also shared a plate of the Bacon cheese fries. They were really good, but it's a massive amount of food. I would most definitely come back.

For real a great burger. Everyone in my party gave it two thumbs up. Service was very nice. Try to find the Groupon which gives you $40 in food for $20. This makes it a much better deal. Otherwise plan to drop at least $20 a person.

Located in the grand canal shops of The Venetian/Palazzo. Wanted to check this place out because I had a groupon. Ordered a oink, squeal & moo burger with sweet potato fries and a nacho platter. Everything was good and fulfilled my burger and nacho cravings. The nacho platter is definitely enough to share. 

This place also serves alcoholic milkshakes for all you non-lactose intolerant folks with a buzzed sweet tooth. I haven't tried them but do check out the menu to find one of your liking.

I'd also like to add that we came 30 minutes before closing because we got lost looking for the place so plan ahead, but I didn't feel rushed when it came to ordering, receiving our meal or paying the bill. There were still other parties who arrived after us and they didn't turn them away so they don't really have a hard closing time. 

Burger spots in Vegas can range from cheap to expensive and this one is right in the middle, though it did help that I had a groupon to cover most of the expenses.

Should change name to SLIMEBURGER!!! Was expecting more... come on... this is the Venetian in Vegas... burgers had hard, frozen buns on top... cheese was cold and sour... burgers were bland... not cooked thoroughly... "In N Out" kicks there butt for far less money... what a joke... I will never come here again!!!
Pretty good! The bacon cheese fries was in abundant, but very salty! The burgers were perfectly made and tasty. Service was nice! Prices are high...check Groupon for a deal before going!
Long wait, expensive and burgers is not all that. Worst part was the poor management, definitely understaffed and over worked employees attitude makes your experience just that much less pleasant

Great burgers cooked the way you ask. We had the Italiano medium rare. The fries were fresh and crispy. We waited in line for over an hour last night at Gordon Ramsey BurGR last night and the burger was over cooked. This was a much better burger and better friendlier service. A hidden gem.

Came here on a groupon. I am a local on a staycation, I would normally never would go to such a touristy place, but thought I'd try it. I ordered the Hawaii five ohh burger. It was ok. The pineapple wasn't very sweet and I didn't think the cole slaw paired very well. My wife got the Cali club burger, she thought it was better than average but nothing to wright home about. The service was excellent. We were well attended on and have nothing but good things to say about Crystal our waitress. It is located in the canal shoppes at Venetian so higher prices are to be expected. All in all I say it is good but not great.
stopped in for a quick bite & was amazed by how great the prime burger was. Nothing fancy but it did not disappoint.

Primeburger had some good tasting food, but in the end it seem a bit overpriced to me. We order a couple burgers, some beer, and a bunch of appetizers. The happy hour was pretty awesome to get 50% off our beer, but there wasn't anything stand-outer amazing about this place, in my opinion.

The buffalo fries were my favorite of the appetizers we ordered... There's nothing like drizzling hot sauce and blue cheese crumbles on anything to make me enjoy it!
Some real good juicy burgers!  Burgers don't come with fries but the side order is more than enough for two.
Place dont look like much, but they make a damn good burger. Wife loved the sweet potato fries.

I had a turkey burger witch you can sub on any burger for free and it was by far the best turkey burger I've had in Vegas the fries are good as well all around great place will be adding this place to my must vegas eats list quick and clean location

I assumed that because the name of the place has the word burger in it that I should order a burger.

I had the Cali Club burger, a Ceasar Salad, and an adult milkshake that had baileys in it. 

The salad was not bad, it was on par with a good side Ceasar salad. The dressing was flavorful, the ingredients were fresh, and it was well portioned.

The burger was just ok. The brioche bun was very soft and had good flavor, that was a plus. The meat was cooked right as I ordered it, but it lacked seasoning. The bacon looked like good quality but it was chewy. They added avocado, mixed greens, and I think thousand island. The mixed greens should be replaced by normal lettuce in my opinion.

The service was good but not stellar. The waitress was hard to understand but she was friendly.

I would recommend the milkshakes - tasty.

Early October 2016

So...still hungry after a wasted visit to Grimaldi's, we stumbled upon Primeburger. If you check your program, you'll note that I don't really like hamburgers. PB, however, claims that its burger contains brisket, which is definitely in my 'like' column. PB was filled with happy diners, which sealed the deal.

Since we were hungry, but not starving, we shared the California burger....so. good. OMG that tendah meat! Add some sweet potato fries and we joined the ranks of happy diners in PB.

Bonus points to a particularly enthusiastic and friendly waiter...we see you, nice guy with dark hair and glasses, we see you!
Fantastic food and great service!  Iliana was a pleasure!  The food was delicious and very generous portions.

This was the best burger I've ever had...the atmosphere pleasant. A little pricey but I'd est there again ...well worth it!And our waiter Andre was as pleasant and wonderful.Not your regular burger place...the three c's...classy,clean,and courteous! Can't ask for much more ...oh and the food...well I'll let that speak for it self?!Go take a drive when your down in Vegas. We definitely will be back !!!

LOTSSSS of burger places in Vegas... but if you happen to walk by this place and severely need food- go ahead and walk on in. These burgers DO NOT disappoint one bit.  I checked in on yelp and received free fries so hayyyyy, thanks yelp !  Good happy hour specials also.
Great place for a damn tasty burger...next time I seriously need to try the spiked milkshakes
This place is the best!! Vegan burger was amazing, service was great as well.. five stars for this restaurant definitely.

This place is phenomenal. The burgers were so good and they tasted very fresh. Our waitress Tomoyo was great. Very friendly and attentive. I will definitely be coming back. I had the Americano burger. Great for being so convenient.

This place did not disappoint! I tried this place after searching for a place to eat, and yelp directed me here. I ordered the scorcher and checked in on yelp to get my free side of fries. I was in a bit of a rush, so things could have moved along a bit quicker. However, I didn't make that known to my server. The restaurant itself is not all that big, but it was just me, so that worked well. 

The burger itself was juicy and flavorful! The cheese was oozing...just the way I like it. I even had it cold as leftovers the next day, and it still tasted great! The fries were awesome! They were also crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. All-in-all, I couldn't have asked for a better burger, and the portions were incredibly generous. If I'm ever craving a burger in Vegas, I won't hesitate to come back here again. The service was also friendly though next time I will come here when I'm not in too much of a rush because they do tend to take their time. It is very much worth it however, and I left very satisfied.

Very surprised to see some recent 1 star reviews. My experience warranted nothing less than 5 stars. BT and I stumbled upon this gem while cruising the Venetian. Initially, I thought that this was "just another burger joint." I could not have been more wrong. The hostess was sweet; our server, Rhonda, was great and attentive, too. As for the food- If you love onion rings, the onion tower is a must! The Panko crust is delicious! I could have just eaten these onion rings and have been happy. But we still had our Cali club burger coming.. This was phenomenal- cooked to a medium masterpiece. Juicy and full of flavor. BT and I split the burger and asked for the egg and mayo on the side- as I can't have these. They remembered and put the egg and mayo on BT's plate. I really love little touches like this. I highly recommend Prime Burger.

The food was pretty good 
I used the Groupon and was able to get two burgers and wings and had to pay extra for the salad without Groupon it's expensive they allowed us to order to go
The front hottest was not ver knowledgeable of the menus and the cashier did not know how to redeem the Groupon 
I ordered the big scorcher with turkey I would definitely give it a 5/5 
The buffalo wings3/5 the place was decent

Staying at the Venetian for a conference. Here's why this place earns four stars:

1) Amazing breakfast!  Yes, that's right: Get super fluffy pancakes, fresh sausage and fresh, strong coffee every morning.

2) Very solid burgers.  The meat is excellent and juicy, the brioche buns are just soft enough to give some nice chew.  Add-ons like bacon, cheeses, etc are all top quality.   Huge portions of crisp fries, too.

3) Convenient location.  Staying at the Venetian?  Just get off on the second floor (Canal Street Shops) and cut through the food court.  It's a 2-minute walk from the elevators in a town where everything is at least a half-mile away.

4) Service.  People are as nice as can be!

My new go-to spot for brekky and burgers!!

This place is great!  Very good quality burger for the price considering the pricier restaurants within the Venetian.  Plus, they have happy hour till 8 pm offering 1/2 price wines by the glass from their menu, beers, and drinks.  You cannot beat that!   I ordered the Big Scorcher, and it was delicious.  There are other places around Vegas rated as top burger joints, but I think this place needs to be considered Tops :)  The service was outstanding too.

Pretty okay burger...i had the Fungus Humongous, which has an entire Portobello cap on it in addition the the burger patty (not exactly what I expected, but I guess I should have...) Only two stars due to a few strange instances with the staff.  The hostess sat us at a patio table, and said "I'd give you a booth buuuuut......" With no further explanation.  There was nobody else in the restaurant.  We didn't really need a booth, but it felt like we were wholly unwelcome inside the establishment.  She also gave us breakfast menus in the middle of the afternoon; we had to ask for lunch menus. The food arrived promptly and was tasty, but our waitress repeatedly commented on how much I had to drink and acted flabbergasted that i wanted a refill (I was drinking Pepsi, not alcohol).  She then made an off kilter remark about how much food we had eaten, which was fairly uncalled for and seemed rude.  The staff seemed to be rushing us out, and on the whole we did not have a welcoming experience.
The best place we ate in all of Vegas! Fantastic breakfast, amazing nachos at lunch, the burgers were delicious, and the shakes... oh my! Can't say enough good things about this place.  *****

We were in the canal shops looking for dinner. Read the menu and decided to give it a try. Totally the right choice. My burger was one of the tastiest I have had in a long time. Obviously fresh beef. My wife raved about her chicken sandwich as well. Carrot cake to die for that I am finishing up this morning for breakfast. LARGE portion!  Friendly attentive staff. Would definitely go back here.

Waitresses were really nice but short handed and it seemed they had no system or method to the madness. I watched my appetizer sit there for about 5-8 minutes which was kind of annoying when it wasn't that hot. For the price they need to be better staffed. Food was ok, didn't blow my mind or anything.

I was there this morning having breakfast!! Very kind services from my server ELISABEH!!!! She is very sweet and profecional on her job!! Food was good , prices very affordable ,even asheel the busser was kind to me with a smile , keep it up guys!!'

NOT PRIME!!!


While it is called "Prime Burger," there is really nothing prime about their service, quality or quantity.  Having gone in with the desire to have a burger that is unique from the fast food venues, what we received was truly not different. Below describes the various elements:

Service:  The service is truly lacking.  The hostess, who provides seating for customers, does not always do so in a polite manner.  We had to wait, even though there were several tables available, and finally put in a minute spot.  We would view many customers requesting a seating and not even be to allowed enter despite a volume of available tables.

It appears the manager of this site was pulling trash cans past the tables of those who were eating.  It is one thing to clean and dump.  However, it should not be done within that realm while customers are eating and drinking.

Waitress: Our waitress was hardly kind or considerate.  We gave our order and asked for water to drink.  She would go here, there, and everywhere but never bring the water to us. We finally had to remind her for what we asked.  When the food came, she never brought any sauces to add to the burgers and fries.  Again, we had to ask for them.

Quality and Quantity:  When you go to burger sites like "In and Out," you are provided a quality hamburger for a reasonable price (usually in the $3.60ish range). PB's $11.00 standard hamburger is hardly worth the price or taste.  There is nothing unique and delicious.  The burger has a large bun, small meat, and messy veggies (the grilled onions were hardly chopped and they kept falling out as you took a bite from the burger.)

The fries were put in a cup but hardly tasted unique.

Plus, my wife had asked that the cheese be put on the side.  She was brought it on the plate and it was spoiled.  She called the waitress, who said "Are not going to eat it?"  My wife said "no."  She was never brought back a fresh piece (see the picture for her frustration).

Bottomline:  To pay $28.00 for two regular burgers and an order of fries (and the lack of service) is hardly prime.  Would not recommend and will never return based upon what we described.

Decent but not great.  Soda fries and a drink were 27.00 with tip.  Not much sauce on my Italian burger and the mozzarella cheese was very cold.  Not a good combo.  I added salt to give it some taste.  Meat tasted good and the fries were excellent.  The brioche bun was very good.

You aren't going to eat cheap in Vegas so this place is not too far overpriced considering it location.  Quick and easy.
We ate here for  lunch on a whim. The service was great but the burgers were just "ok".  Not to mention the one I had made me super ill later.

I understand it was memorial weekend but there were only 3-4 tables in the restaurant. Walked in around 2pm , ordered 2burgers and fries around 2:10pm. At 2:30pm we were still waiting and 2:50 we just walked out of restaurant without any food. Starving, with no valid explanation about the reason why there was almost 1hour delay on our food. 4tables with significant delay on the order is not really understandable. We had to find another place to eat in a hurry. Not recommending this place.
Our waiter was Andres and he was fantastic. We came for burgers and had steak instead. Great recommendation Andres!

I purchased a groupon for Prime Burger, such is the only reason I'm giving 4 stars. Posting full price would have resulted in 3 stars. 

The good : service was great and the staff was friendly and attentive.

The bad: 
1. it's located in Venetian's food court (which wouldn't be an issue, but if your spending almost $20 for one burger, it would be nice to be a little more enclosed and exclusive) 

2. The food is good but not worth the price tag. At the current price tag its pretty Mediocore. 

Will I come back? Maybe, but only with a discount.

Solid 4 star, Rhonda our waitress ? 5 Star..  I had the Fungus Humongous burger which I migh add was phenomenal.  I really didn't have high hopes for this place since it really wasn't crowded but  don't let that fool you !  This place has excellent service, and excellent food. The burgers on the brioche bun just melt in your mouth and the fries are fresh and crispy.  The only reason this place isn't 5 star is that for the price of the burger it should be a bit bigger.  Would I come back for another burger or two?  Most definitely..  This is a hidden gem of a burger joint.  A definite must try and don't forget to have it on a brioche bun !
Great for a late night meal! Had the Portobello mushroom sandwich, field of greens salad and topped it off with the Bailey's, Kaluha, Oreo, and Banana shake. Delicious!

Went here for the first time ..ordered a Burger  I was asked brioche or wheat?  I replied Brioche was brought a wheat bun burger. Then told oh we ran out of Brioche. Uhhhh how about communication.  Sorry we ran out would you like to get it on wheat or cancel or something else. Hmmm

Definitely make a reservation because the space isn't that big. I got in, order and had my food in seven minutes, crazy fast. Staff was on the move working hard and very nice. The nachos ARE a meal. Loved it! I'd come again.

Ok so I had went in to get the special a 6oz filet fries onion straws and mushrooms for 19 dollars get in and look at menue saw what they had and decided on the oink squeele moo burger. This burger was amazing I loved it so much. It had the patty a mix of chuck,short ribs,and brisket. Then they put bacon and pulled pork cheddar cheese and mayo. Nothing over powered anything you could taste every single component of the burger. My wife got the special and she loved it. Service was amazing manager was expediting plates server helping other server. Went in on happy hour got gin and tonics for under 4 bucks you can't beat that. Would go back in a heartbeat

Two thumbs up from a person that doesn't really care of burgers in the first place. 

I'm just not a big burger person but every once in a while I crave a good juicy burger. One with a tender juicy meat patty, fluffy bun, sautéed mushrooms and perfectly melted cheese. The Fungus Humongous hit the spot. Loved the big slices of portobello mushrooms and perfectly cooked patty. I asked for medium and got medium. Trust me, that doesn't happen everywhere. 

The service was top notch. Food was served with a smile and came out quickly. The bacon cheese fries were freshly fried and yummy. The place was clean. Glad we found a groupon for this place. Allowed us to find an awesome burger joiny

I came here because of Groupon I love a coupon however it's kind a like a tease because you end up spending way more after appetizers and drinks. The service was great and the food was really good to small little restaurant located inside of the Venetian. I like the burger choices and we had the wings and they were really good.

REALLY good burger.. The beef is extremely tasty. It is NOT fast.  My order took about 15 minutes to arrive (it is a busy place.)   Fries were piping hot and shoestring thin.  They are supposed to be hand cut.  I suppose they may be, but they tasted like high quality frozen ones.  They came free with a Yelp checkin so no complaints.  I'd eat there again.

Two thumbs up for AMAZING everything!  I had the Hawaii 5-O, the burger was exceptional.  The service was great. Manager ended up taking care of us because of how busy they were.  I highly recommend this place for anyone who wants great food.  I can't wait to come back!

Been there twice as I always stay at Palazzo when visiting Vegas.  First trip was 5 stars all the way.  Fast, friendly, attentive service and a fantastic burger.  The second visit was not as good.  Same server as previously, and the poor lady was dealing with incompetence from the kitchen and management the whole time.  Burger was just OK this time as it has some very stale and tough to chew onion strings on it.  Also, the hostess in front looked as if she wanted to die.
Angel was a wonderful server. Everything was on point here. Excellent food! A must try! We couldn't have had a better experience!

4.5 stars. Great service. Andre was really great. Burger was good and big. Meat is a blend of chuck, brisket and another meat, so unique. Kind of greasy though. Definitely not for the health conscious but our waiter did offer wheat buns and they are open to healthier substitutions.

The chicken sandwich was juicy and delicious. It went great with the pulled pork nachos! My wife and daughter had the burgers and the onion ring tower. The only con is that the place is next to the food court so a bit noisy and no beers on draft.

First time diner, ate here yesterday! Small and quaint dining area which provided for a more intimate setting in the bustling food court at the Venetian. Rosa (host) and Christina (server) greeted me with a warm and familiar smile. Christina happily gave us more time to look at the menu, and continuously checked to see that we had all we needed. Sodio (manager) checked on our table twice despite having to jump on the grill and deal with unruly customers. The vegan burger was delicious! (and thankfully not dried out). The fries came out hot and delish...and frankly it was a lot more than we could eat! Overall dining experience was a 5 star rating! As a Chef, business owner, and LV local I understand more than most about the perpetual flow of the restaurant. The efficiency and quality of service of Primeburger's staff rivals that of its neighboring competitors! Thank you! Keep up the great work!

The burger was delicious! Very flavorful, fresh, and juicy.  The brioche bun was also fresh and tasty. 2 people in my party also got the filet mignon special for $19.99.  Both the steaks and burgers were cooked perfectly .  I would definitely recommend this place especially if you purchase the Groupon. The burgers do not come with anything so you need to pay for fries or whatever separately.

I was surprised it was so good. I used a Groupon and it's in a fast-food kind of place, not a regular restaurant. My friend and I both had very tasty and juicy burgers. Cooked medium rare and cooked properly. Much better than Gordon Ramsay's BURger.

Chances Of Going Back: 0/5
Would Suggest To Others? No
What I Ordered: Waffles With Strawberries: 1/5
Murf's Tip: Sit closer to the shops for good people watching while you eat

(+)
- Convient Location
- One Of The Only Places Serving Early Breakfast In The Area

(-)
- Overpriced
- Small Portion Sizes

We woke up early one day and needed to find somewhere that was serving breakfast, it's harder than you would think. We stumbled across Primeburger, checked the Yelp reviews, and decided to check it. The service was slow (with a near empty restaurant), the portion sizes were small, and the pricing were that of some of the mid-level buffets....I ordered the waffles and opted to add strawberries. Well, the strawberries had a distinct taste of onion, I had others taste it to make sure it wasn't just me, it wasn't. I am not sure if the food prep crossed, the dishes weren't washed well, or the fruit had been in the same container, but I was highly disappointed in this meal.

Not a bad burger but still, you don't get what you expect from a $15+ burger. Meat was totally undercooked even though we ordered well done, very bad for the kids. Fries cost extra. Not really worth it.

Absolutely delicious! My boyfriend and myself stopped here real quick because we were too hungry to continue searching. We weren't really expecting much but decided to split the filet mignon special and their pork nachos ... and HOLY COW! Amazing. 
This place definitely exceeded our expectations and we'll be coming back for sure!

The food at Primeburger was very good...delicious burgers and buffalo wings.  This place is a little on the expensive side which is why I purchase a their Groupon deal 20.00 for 40.00 of food for 4 people.  Please note you will be spending approx. 18.00 - 25.00 per person.  The Americana burger alone is 13.00 add fries is another 4.50 and iced tea another 3.75.  The only complaint I had was if you check in via Yelp you will received FREE order of their fries but they will NOT accept both your Groupon and the Yelp offer.  Again, the food was delicious burgers were juicy, hand cut french fries and buffalo wings were spot on.  Everything is ala-carte but if you are located in the food court at the Venetian that's the price you pay.  Enjoy!

Try the americana burger with the brioche bread. One of tastiest burgers you can ever had and for only $ 10 great value at the Venetian. Tasty Ceaser salad as well, good and fresh. Chris our server was very attentive andf the staff was courteous and keep our drinks filled the whole time. Excellent, cannot wait to go back

Came here for a late lunch with my wife.  Burgers were great, enjoyed the sweet potato fries as they were crispy, not the greasy soggy kind we find in many places. 
Happy hours beers added to the enjoyment. 
Andres was our server and did a great job. 
I'll go back on my next trip to LV.
This place is pretty good. If you are in the mood for a hunger come here. Decently priced for vegas and tastes good.

Grab a Groupon coupon and head to this joint! The burgers are soooo good, and the bacon cheese fries are a greasy, salty treat! They have alcoholic shakes too, great happy hour drink specials, can't beat it for being on The Strip!
Probably one of the best burgers I've ever had! Service isn't great, but overall amazing food.

You would think that a burger joint located in the food court of the upper end casino would have been created in jest but this spot did not disappoint.

Since we had an amazing steak experience the day before, we felt a simple burger trip would be good, despite having interest in checking the Heart Attack Grill.  Unfortunately, the problem with eating so well is being pretty damn full for the entire day.

Primeburger is located in the foodcourts of The Venetian.  While I was not expecting this, our experience was good.  I ordered their primeburger since the heat outside had diminished my appetite and it came out, on a large dish.  Not elaborate or plated too fancy.  A bit greasy but not too bad. Service was good and perhaps next time, I'll try one of their milkshakes!

The burger was definitely very very good! The fries were very good but nothing over the top. I dinged them a star because after I ordered I asked to redeem my free fries when I checked in and the girl did not want to reimburse me even though I had just literally checked out and they were $4 fries!

Angel my server was great.! I have a sugar allergy, which sucks because they have amazing looking milk shakes, but angel was able to fine tune my meal to make it both great and timely.
P.s try the burgers protein style over kale

Came with my family, and trust me I was expecting more. The meat had no flavor, so I had to add salt and pepper. The portions were good but keep in mind it comes with no sides. The service was good and our waiter checked on us often. I was honest with him and he offered to give us free dessert but we declined. We ordered The Italians, The 21st, The American and The Bacon & Egg Burger, one order of fries, two soft drinks and one Blue Moon and our bill came out to about $95. Would of been happier with In & Out or Mc Donald's.

Waited for over 30 min.  Server didn't care that we had no drinks or food. Staff was just standing around talking. Poor service and customer experience.  Unacceptable that we were ignored considering the many many options for dining. First and last time going here. Several other restaurants at the Venetian were outstanding.

And yum.. not sure what a previous complained about.. sweetest waitress .. burgers were DEOISH.. Fries yummy.. friend ordered milkshake.. and it was great.. absolutely worth the walk from the palazzo..

PRIME burger... Definitely not PRIME Service. 
Burger and fries were great... Price is definitely up there with "boutique burgers"...and for the price, the service should be much better. My wife was still half way through her burger and waiter was already rushing the bill... Gotta keep moving time of place.
It's a good greasy burger. The fries are good not great. The service is somewhat slow for a burger place.

Food has gone done hill since my last visit in 2016.  Fries lumpy,  ground beef patty varies in size. Over  fried onion rings, dirty spoon so noticeable,.  We are a party of four, waitress put 3 bottles of ketchups on out table and told us each bottle has a little bit.  REALLY? Lazy waitress.  Would not come back.

We stumbled across Prime Burger while looking for somewhere to grab a quick bite before we headed out for the night. Located just past the food court we found the restaurant to be empty but decided to try it out. 

I had a frenchie and my girlfriend had the americana Burger. Both burgers were cooked to perfection and had amazing flavor. You have a choice of bun but fries are extra - get an order to share as there are plenty. The burgers here were made with fresh meat and homemade sauces. Service was great as well.

If you are looking for a bite to eat in the Canal Shoppes at the Venetian, stop here! You will not be disappointed at all. The prices were moderate but well worth every bite. Bill came out to $30 which was comparable to the Johnny Rockets inside the food court.

I was pleasantly surprised on how much I enjoyed this establishment . I had eaten at a restaurant on the Las Vegas strip where it ended up costing us about 300 dollars on what turned out to be a mediocre meal . For something smaller and not as flashy , I can easily say I enjoyed prime burger much more . The staff was great and friendly . Food was very good . I come from the serving industry so I tend to be picky, but my whole experience was great . The manager Aubrey stopped by the table and engaged in conversation with us. He was just far more personable than I've encountered at other places . Great job , prime burger !

3 women with a groupon drinking water with lemon: a server's nightmare.
Not for our server, Justin, though.  He was friendly and attentive with a good sense of humor.   Burgers were great and Caesar salad was fresh and delicious. Sweet potato fries were perfectly cooked and terrific.  Save room for the carrot cake. It's not pricey for the quality and portions, our bill was around $40 after the $20 groupon. If you go with a coupon, please remember to tip on the original amount!

Best Burgers in Vegas by far!!!!! My wife and I know burgers and this restaurant is the best. It's a great lunch spot. It's great price for the value and service we get!!! The waitress Iliana did an awesome job! She was on her A game and very friendly!!! All in all, every time I come to Vegas I will definitely come to primeburger!

The service was amazing, the food was amazing. We were looking for something easy, and somewhat inexpensive. We had the wings, two milkshakes, and shared the bacon egg, and cheese burger. Perfect portions! The service was the best we have had so far in Vegas!!! 


In love!!

I understand that it was rather busy inside this bustling little burger joint. Every seat seemed filled and I was worried that this may take a bit however I was in and out rather quickly. My server took my order with a smile and even made recommendations at my request and she was right, the California Chicken was rather delicious. Well seasoned though pretty heavy-handed on the mayo. But I would have been ever so  pleased (with even my mayo drenched chicken sammy) if it was not for the horrible service. Though my server greeted me with a smile and took my order quickly I never saw her again...until I got my card out. She forgot my beverage. Water...which, isn't that just a given anyway at most places? And it isn't even as though she asked someone else to deliver it to me. No. She was happily avoiding me. I tried three times to get her attention but to no avail. I had to stop someone and ask them to please give me some water. I thought she would come back and offer me the lemon I requested or even a straw...nothing fancy, just the basics. But no. Again, I had to stop someone. When someone else came with my food sans the sauce I ordered I thought she would come by and do a table check. Nope. I had to stop someone else. When pulled my card out and placed it one the table...guess who showed up?! Do you think she even asked me how my meal went? Ha! NO! She ran my card, gave me my receipt and again, was never heard from. When I was finished and had to dash I AGAIN had to stop someone else and ask them for a box. Without a doubt the worst service I HAVE EVER HAD. So all in all an overpriced mayo drenched sandwich and an absentee server....no thanks. I would rather take my business elsewhere if I was going to have to chase down the things I ordered piece by piece. Save your money and go to Subway across the way, at least they HAVE to interact with you. 

Sincerely, 

The Invisible Patron

The hostess was snobby. We had to wait 12 minutes without having our drink orders taken or even given water.

The burgers were delicious, but nothing too extraordinary. The fries were almost perfect, but they were over salted. 

The waitress was very sweet once she finally got to us.

$7.00 Breakfast- Don't waste your time. How do you mess up eggs and toast? Well these guys/girls have that down pat. The middle aged girl who waited on me was a cruel hiring joke by Management. At 7am she seats me and hands me the burger menu? I asked do you server burgers now? A casual "No" is what I got. Then why am I looking at the burger menu I'm thinking? Ordered the $7 breakfast and got the 2 ends of the bread loaf (See photo), including the butt. I said "are you really going to serve this"? Her response was we serve everything and nobody's complained before". Really? I wasn't complaining, just pointing out that that the cook must be a beginner.
