Breakfast potatoes are those cubed frozen kind that really are the cheapest you can buy from a vendor. 
Burgers- Had a Groupon and came back for dinner. The oink, squeal and moo was very good. Just remember. This is a burger joint. Trying to pull off breakfast to pick up a few extra dollars on your establishment, does more harm than good to your reputation.

4 star food with 0 star service. I dont know if we offended them by bringing our children or what but they clearly didn't want our business.

First, they took over 10 minutes to take our order. Our server was clearly annoyed by our table as looked like she sucked on a sour lemon anytime she came over to us.

We had to wait over 5 minutes after we asked for our bill and, as I write this, am still waiting for them to cash us out. Seriously? This is ridiculous. They aren't even busy.

Gonna keep this short and sweet, freshly made HIGH quality burgers, cooked to temperature, not frozen, great selection, nice wait staff AND alcoholic MILKSHAKES! This place is BOMBdotCom! Prices could be a lot cheaper but it is on the strip so of course you are going to get strip prices, there are 3 other burger places in the building and this one is the overall winner Oshkosh be gosh!

Not bad! We came here super last minute. We ordered a bunch of things that were good but definitely the favorites were the onion rings and portobello veggie burger. We didn't like the sweet potato fries... they were way too sweet.
We were here for breakfast this morning and dinner tonight. Phenomenal food, great service and all for a very reasonable price.  Too bad we're leaving tomorrow or we'd be back!

Very tasty burger, specialty fries and adult milk shakes.

Had the Cali Burger - medium rare and juicy.  Really tasty.  Ordered a side of sweet potato French fries.  And topped it off with a mudslide milk shake.

Price is a high for that combo (around $40 with a tip).
But it's on the strip in the Grand Canal Shops so that's expected.

If you check in there is a free fries offer.

4 out of 5 stars.

Don't waste your money here! Food is good but the service sucks to say the least. This is a burger joint with overpriced burgers. The Grand Lux serves burger that run about the same price and include fries. Not kid friendly with no kid options.
Was seated by the hostess and given Menus. Sat and waited for 15 minutes without anyone coming by to take our order or greet us. Got up and left.

One of the top 5 burgers I have ever eaten.  Was very pleasently surprised.  Prices are inflated like everything on the strip though.  Even with that $50+ bill for 2 burgers, fries and a beer each, it was really good.

We decided to go here because we found a groupon and also because of the many positive yelp reviews.  This had to be one of the best burgers I've ever had!  Service was also top notch.  The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is because the french fries were a little soggy.  But this is definitely on our list of places to go in Vegas.
We had breakfast and it was great!! The waffles even smelt yummy. Really nice staff. Wish we had found this place earlier. Not a huge selection but that's ok. What they have they do well.

This is a restaurant located on the Grand Canale Shoppes inside the Venetian casino.   It is a gourmet burger joint with a higher end decor to go with it.   Think Fatburger win artisanal burger styles and a fancy looking seating area.   There are a variety of burgers to choose from starting with the Americana at 13.50 and going up around $18 with the spots.  The meat is supposed to be higher quality ground beef.   I can say that I was satisfied with the meal and am willing to come back here again.   It allows more of a good burger eating with a seating area that does not feel like a fast food joint.

This could have been a really enjoyable lunch on a recent Saturday except for really bad service.

The waitress was very odd-she was interested in pushing the alcoholic milkshakes and gladly brought those at our table who ordered those shakes and water and paid a lot of attention to them, while those on the other end who "just" ordered soft drinks had to ask multiple times for refills and god forbid, water as well.

It took several trips and probably 30 minutes to get our entire order turned in and the place was half full (or half empty if you prefer), meaning about 7 tables either way.  Body language and tone of the server were poor as well.   Read my other reviews-I rarely mention less than excellent service at all but this was bad.

Food was decent-blackened mahi sandwich was what I had, but $16 for just the sandwich felt a bit much, but you're in the part of town where you pay more for what you get.   Fries and sweet potato fries were good all around.

Went here yesterday for lunch, I do have Groupon, but even with that , food is still pricey considering the quality, burger patty is bland and very thin, all the other elements of the burger had over powered it, it is juicy I'll give them that, but it's tasteless and fast-food burger patty thin. The shake was OK but then again you can't go wrong with mudslide, fries are well , ordinary too, location, it is in the Venetian so it may be convenient but the are no views, you'll just see people passing by heading to the food court which is probably a better choice. And the service, I wouldn't count on that as well. Overall a complete waste of time and money.

I usually put burgers into three categories. Fast food at $6-10, gourmet at $10-17and high-end at $18+. As I compare them to other burger places like Holsteins and Gordon Ramsay, this compares very nicely while being a tad bit cheaper than those burgers. As we went there for lunch, we were in and out very quickly between office lunch hours. I will definitely be back to try other burgers but the standard American burger was very enjoyable while service was impeccable.
Good burger spot, I enjoyed the frenchie with crafted fries. Also had the rum banana milkshake, a little light on the rum but good overall

These are some messsy people !! They charged my card an additional 25$ aside from what i originally had to pay. The food was good but after this i will never return and i do not recommend. I was charged an additional 25$ with out my knowledge !!! Please stay away
Was in the other day and had an amazing Cali burger what a great place to eat food was Great and the service was amazing can't wait to be back in Vegas to come in and try other burgers

Pretty good burger. Food was really fast and staff very nice. 

Has full bar and also has tables to sit if you have a group.

Only con: fries are a little soggy and not crispy.


Overall very good and worth the price.
Good burger, service was so so. I like Strip Burger and Umami Burger better but I would give this place a go again.

this place is inside Venetian hotel casino next to the food court, get the Vodka S'mores, it's a bomb... service is great, go there after 4:00 pm, get the filet mignon for $19.95, come with salad, mushroom, bread, fries, onion rings, and the meat melt in your mouth...good deal..

Felt like a good burger for lunch today and Primeburger fit the bill.  It was just a short walk through the Grande Canal Shoppes to get there from my room in the Palazzo.

They weren't very busy at 2pm on a Wednesday as there were just about 3 tables filled.  Service was quick and attentive (probably since they weren't busy).

I order a Americana burger (cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, thousand island...I know, I am boring).  It was perfectly prepared, juicy and flavorful.  With my check in from Yelp, I got an order of fries for free.  Good thing...as they were a disappointment.  They were a little soggy and soft.  The flavor wasn't bad, but they should have been a little crisper with some additional seasoning.

Prices were on a par with other high-end burgers places like Zinburger or similar, which for Las Vegas is pretty good.

On balance, I would return.  I just wouldn't order the fries.  Soggy fries was a one star deduct.

the food tasted okay but 4 out of 6 of us got sick after eating here. We all ordered our meals with small modifications and they didn't get them right, took a long time to take our order, and never cleared our table of the appetizer plates. I will definitely not be back.

In order to try and save money during our Vegas trip we looked on Groupon to find somewhere to eat.  We were staying at a hotel nearby and decided that this restaurant located in the Venetian would be an ideal spot.  

When we arrived it was shortly before 4.  We were given menus and the server explained that the steak special would begin at 4 and offered for us to wait to order until that time to take advantage of this deal.  We asked if we could still redeem a Groupon while taking advantage of that deal and were told yes.  My sister and my husband both ordered the steak dinner, for my son a cheeseburger and for me, well I opted for bacon cheese fries.  The food came out in a timely manner and was all delicious. I was surprised how large the servings were.  You will definitely receive a large meal at Prime Burger.  

The only downfall for me was that there was no kids menu.  The only option was to order my 5 year old a burger of his own which at about $13 for a basic burger is not ideal.

The burgers might be good but the breakfast needs work. 
I will say the eggs are fresh cracked but the waffles are under done, the country potatoes come out of a bag with no onions or other garnishment. The omelettes are uninspired and under done. 
The staff is nice and they try hard but the breakfast fair falls short. 
Tons of places to eat breakfast so skip this one.

Out of all of the Italian restaurants in the Venetian we chose to eat here...and I am SO glad! The hostess who convinced us into eating at PrimeBurger was adorable, sweet, and very convincing, good job! Our server (wish I remember his name) was SO helpful, funny, easy to talk to, attentive, and courteous. He actually got us excited about what we were ordering. My best friend and I each got a spiked milkshake...what an awesome idea! My friend got the Nutella shake which had some kind of Irish liquor in it I believe and it was incredibly rich and tasted so creamy and had Nutella smeared all over the glass...delish. I had the oreo, banana, and peanut butter spiked milkshake. Heaven...absolute heaven. I can't even put into words the creamy, delicious, flavor explosion of this drink!! Really hit the spot, so perfect. For an appetizer, we split the buffalo fries. I thought this was such an awesome, unique, and simple idea I never heard of. Fries covered in hot sauce with bleu cheese dipping sauce and bleu cheese crumbles. Tasted amazing and were definitely filling. I thought hot sauce on fries would be less filling (lol) but theFries were very, very filling. I ordered a Frenchie burger without the bun and it was still very filling. On the burger came Swiss cheese, Gruyere cheese (my favorite), lettuce, and dijon mustard. Not the best burger I have ever had, but definitely REALLY good and really different. Come here with an empty stomach! Loved it here.

Amazing food, amazing staff.  The bacon egg & cheese burger was phenomenal!  Cooked to perfection and bursting with flavor.  Our waiter, Andres, was awesome!  Funny and attentive without hovering.  Just a great experience all around.  I'll definitely be back!

Disappointing. Filet mignon that wasn't a Filet cut that I've ever experienced.  Ordered rare and was overcooked. We didn't send back because we were tired and hungry... but couldn't finish the steak due to it was just too tough to enjoy. Not really any flavor/seasoning on the steak. No horseradish in the house. Server brought us ketchup and 57 sauce and we didn't request it, like we were inexperienced steak eaters... we're over age 40. Didn't ask how our meal was, didn't offer dessert. We ordered water and the only visit back was out of necessity. Had to stare down the waitress who was eating and chatting with another waitress and male floor manager (we assumed by dress) to request our check. It was obvious we wanted a check, we'd already stacked our plates at the edge of the table. Booked on OpenTable for 515 seating for today Sept 5th, arrived at 5. OpenTable reservation still not observed so we can receive our points for booking. Cannot believe this place is surviving with this service and 'filet mignon' cut. Gah

This place is amazing! We ordered kale salad, buffalo wings, and a burger with fries. The order was to go and when we got back to our hotel room the food was still fresh. Everything was flavorful and simply great. The next time I'm in Las Vegas, this place is a must!
Best hamburger! Love it..,I will be back..best customer service ever...the bacon Fries are so so big more then one person can eat them! Hamburgers done how you like them

My kids are like roosters and wake up really early every morning. My kids and I decided to make an adventure and walk through the walkways of the canal between hotels. Fortunately we found this gem while staying in the Palazzo hotel. We saw a picture of some pancakes, which my kids were already sold on, and saw that it opened up early (around 0700). My wife and I decided to give it a try. We ordered some pancakes and waffles for the boys. My wife and I had some coffee. The server, Ana, provided exceptional service. She saw that the kids were stacking the half and half condiments and brought another set for the parents to use so we wouldn't be taking away from their game. She was very attentive and was kind enough to offer  to go cups for our coffee as we were getting ready to leave. My kids are allowed and I noticed that they would sit the other guests on the other side of the restaurant, which was nice for my family and their dining experience.

Primeburger for breakfast!

Conveniently located in The Venetian hotel food court, this upscale burger joint now serves breakfast.  

The bf and I wanted to grab a quick bite before we started our Sunday and stumbled upon this modern burger joint.  It was a lucky find as it was relatively empty and we were able to get in and out within a half hour.  

The menu had a good variety of breakfast options (served until 11:30am) including alcoholic milkshakes. 
We opted for the egg white omelette and the regular omelette with hash browns and wheat toast.  The food arrived quickly and was very good and in huge portions.  

Service was friendly and attentive.

Rounding up from a 4.7, this restaurant rates a 5 for a quick breakfast spot in the Venetian.

Vegas is a totally different experience when you've got a little one with you. We made it to our hotel pretty late on a Sunday night. Got checked in to the Venetian and went looking for a place where we could get food and drinks, quickly, and with a one year old. Yelp helped us find Primeburger and it was perfect. No wait. We were seated right away and they brought a high chair for our little. Sat down, ordered a few drinks, just a beer for me but a boozy shake for my hubby. His was an Oreo banana shake which was delicious and tasted like way too many calories--but worth it. Burgers were cooked to perfection. I had a spicy jalapeño one, can't remember what it was called but I enjoyed it. Ate the entire thing. Fries (free with yelp check in) were also good. Service was good even though they were getting ready to close up shop. We'll be back here next time we stay at the Venetian/Palazzo for sure.

Don't bypass this incredible gem because it sits unobtrusively surrounded by some pretty low rank food court haunts which frankly don't belong in a Vegas Resort setting. The burgers are fabulous. Now if you are not accustomed to eating real, hand crafted burgers, get ready for a real treat. I spent 12 years living in Nebraska, about as a snotty a beef state as they come. You don't stay that long without learning the art of a good burger. So with my burger snob hat on, I'll tell you these are far better than an ordinary burger. If you normally dine on fast food burgers, though using dine and fast food in the same sentence is ridiculous, take a few extra minutes and sit down, relax and enjoy a truly American experience. The service is absolutely friendly and down to earth. And extraordinarily accommodating when I start switching up the cheese, holding the mayo and pretty much crafting my own take on a burger. 
So if you are in the neighborhood, meaning the Grand Canal Shoppes and vicinity, make sure your hungry, and don't miss this one. PS, the cheese fries are amazing.

I bought a Groupon for here since it was located in our hotel.  We came here for dinner, and I ordered The Big Scorcher and Sweet Potato Fries to share.  Yelp does have a check-in offer for free fries, but we were not able to use that offer with our Groupon. The burger was good; it was juicy and the texture of the brioche bun was good.  We were satisfied with our nice, quick dinner.  And service was really great.

We each had a burger and a shake. We weren't feeling like a big meal, nor a food court meal.  I was pleasantly surprised to find this quaint little, mini-restaurant located near the food court area as you're walking away from the Venetian, towards the Grand Canal Shoppes.  

The burger was tasty, I even ate the bun...I rarely eat that part, but it was good, too.  Since it's in Vegas, we asked for our liquor infused shakes to be served in to-go cups!  Those tasted good, but could have used more alcohol content considering they cost about the same as our burgers.  Overall, it was a good choice for our semi-casual Vegas dinner.

They have such great tasting food here - I would recommend eggs with mushroom and spinach the only reason I didn't give it five stars is that my companion ordered the same thing but they ran out of mushrooms and spinach.

However, the staff here have great service.

Prime Burger is well past its prime. If you want an overpriced burger in the food court section of a casino, then by all means come on through. Now, I'm the kind of girl who doesn't mind splurging for a flavorful burger. My burger was extremely bland, so I tried to doctor it up with extra condiments. Nothing worked! The onion rings and fries were good, but it's really hard to mess that up. It wasn't the worst, but nothing noteworthy.
Good Food and friendly staff. I had a chicken Cesar salad and it was delicious. Chicken was well seasoned and juicy.   Nice place for a quick bite.

went here because of Groupon, costly for nothing, waiter must have been new, received my six dollar espresso cold, asked for ranch for my kids that never came and for a small establishment waiter was mia so I couldn't even waive him down to get iy,  my health nut burger mushroom was like eating a liver. never again

Go after 4pm and get the filet mignon. SOoooo good!! And only 24! I had a Groupon for 20 off food. Great place. Doesn't look like a  special, but it is good! Was here last summer on vacation, made sure to go back this year.

I loved this place! I had the bacon egg and cheeseburger and it was to die for! The meat is flavorful and juicy. The bacon was top notch. The egg served in the burger was just awesome and the yolk was golden, gooey, and decadent in the burger. Fries are big enough to be shared. And they have alcoholic milkshakes. I will be definitely be back here on my next trip to Las Vegas!

We were in Vegas for a weekend and knew we would be spending a good amount of money so we were looking for some cheaper things to do or eat during the day.  We found a Groupon for Prime Burger and the Venetian is conveniently located so we bought a deal for $20 for $40.

Prime Burger is located in the Shops in Grand Canal and was really easy to get to.  When we arrived, a little before 4pm with our party of four, we were immediately greeted and seated. Our waiter, Andres was very pleasant, he broke down the menu for us and even suggested if we wait about 5 minutes to order, we could partake in the steak specials, which two of us did.

The food was brought our hot and I really enjoyed the NY Strip I received.  It was cooked perfectly and the sides were great.  I think everyone enjoyed their food and Andres was on top of getting us drink refills and was attentive and talkative with us.

At the end of our meal, we had no issue redeeming our Groupon and the transaction went smoothly.  I would return.

If you're looking for a good bite to eat, definitely stop into Primer Burger. The menu isn't incredibly extensive, but the items they have are done well.

If you're a party of 2, go ahead and buy the groupon that's for 4 people. The one for 2 people isn't enough money, due to prices already being high. The burgers were good and the shakes were awesome. The location is kinda confusing. It is in the Venetian hotel, right across Waffle bar. It's not a big resturant and has limited seating.

What a great place for burgers. We were hungry on a Saturday night and stop by. The burger is very Juicy and Delicious. I think is better than Gordon Ramsay's Burger on the other side of the strip. And addition the prices are very reasonable for being in a hotel

This burger was the best burger I have eaten in a long time. You can definitely taste the difference in the meat. The meat is really delicious and juicy. I ordered the Cali Club and put red onions on it and it was amazing!! Definitely recommend this place to anyone!  The Caesar salad was also amazing, the dressing and cheese was amazing!! The only downside was the noise, but that comes with any casino food court.

Best burger I have had in years. I keep wanting to go back, but time and availability isn't lining up. Burger alone is 5 stars. Other details bring them down a star.

Free delicious fries with Yelp check in!

My BF got the spicy burger medium rare but it came rare. He doesn't usually like well done burger but he said it was way too mushy like it was and actually really liked my burger. I was sad for him because he chose it as a quick birthday dinner. [We went to Ramsay's Burgr to make up for this meal later so it wasn't a total loss for him! :P I like Prime Burger MUCH more.] In any case because prime uses a duo of beef cuts, opt for more well done if you don't want a super soft burger. We didn't complain about rare vs med rare, so we have no idea how they would have fixed it, but I bet they would have recooked his burger. Service was overall very friendly and helpful. 

I ordered my burger well done and it was the best burger I've had in years. Tender and juicy, not excessively fatty at all. I got the one with bacon and pulled pork. My only gripe is that the pulled pork wasn't a clean pull and had huge gooey lumps of fat. I opened my burger and had to scrape that off. Bacon was also more flabby than crunchy and I'm a crunchy bacon gal. I would order a regular burger next time and be happy I think. It wasn't a total loss because my fiancé inherited my bacon and we used the pork (after I cleaned it) to make delicious pork+fries+pickle bites.

Don't bother with the alcoholic shakes as they had zero discernible alcohol and were mildly pricy for what you got. 

Something is off with their soda machine. I tried Dr Pepper and it was WEIRD. Tasted like diet almost but not quiet? I replaced it with a cola and it was also really off tasting. Hope they get that tweaked and fixed.
Sunday Funday with my poppie @ The Venetian we have the panko crusted onion rings.  Bailey, Kahlu'a & bananas.  21st century burger & the BEC burger & handcut fries..  Absolute delicious

Amazing Burgers!  My husband had the Oink, Squeal, Moo Burger - Bacon, pulled pork with BBQ sauce and onion strings.  Great flavor.  He was a happy man!  I had the Scorcher - Sriracha mayo, pepperjack cheese, onion strings on a fresh brioche bun.  The mayo added some serious flavor...really good.  My son had a classic Americana burger.  In his words "Divine!"  We also ordered a panko crusted stack of onion rings.  Only 5 - but really thick.  Perfect amount to share.  It came with ranch and "SECRET SAUCE"  - crispy and great flavor.  We would have liked to try one of their awesome looking alcoholic shakes, but A - it was before noon and B- we were stuffed!  Can't wait to go back....

Wherever I go I always look for a burger place. I came across this place as I walked from my hotel to the Venetian shops. It's a very casual little spot. I ordered the burger with pulled pork and bacon. Also an order of French fries. The burger was PERFECT. The bread was greasy, the meat was so good and juicy, the pulled pork was flavorful. It was the perfect burger. It's an awesome place for lunch.

I saw them on groupon so I gave them a shot.  I ordered the filet mignon and a CaliClub to eat, the burger was good but not great.  The filet looked and tasted like a top round steak.  I also ordered 3 milkshakes, 2 vanilla for the kids and 1 of the alcoholic versions for myself.  They only filled the shake cups half way. I told the manager the shakes should be filled to the top and he asked me if I paid for 1 shake but had them split it in 2 cups, I said no. Then he said they put a lot of alcohol in it and that is why they are small and expensive.  I explained to him that they were for my kids so there was no alcohol in them.  His response was conversation ending rude "Well, It's Vegas".  Their slogan should be Small portions, Mediocre Quality, & High Prices because Hey, It's Vegas!
The food was good, but not for the price. It was pretty expensive. The free fries was a nice addition (see Yelp coupon above), but they weren't that good. The service was fair.

Rolled in around 10:30 AM and proceeded to order breakfast but was told by the server that they ran out of breakfast. I was shocked because I had never been to a restaurant that was out of food on a normal day... let alone a restaurant in Vegas. We were already seated so we decided to just order lunch; I ordered the Mahi Mahi burger and it was no better than airport food. It tasted like a burger I could get at an airport bar/restaurant. 

I would not recommend going after 10:15 for breakfast, as it seems they run out of food. If you have the opportunity, try a lobster roll from the restaurant across the walkway.
Kahlua alcohol shake, panko crusted onion rings and a bacon egg cheeseburger crazy good.

Their bacon cheese fries are to die for! The wings are super delicious but not worth the price. It's $10 for 6 wings and their really small. Other than that they have a variety of different burgers, the only thing that sucks is fries don't come with it so that's extra money you have to pay. After 4pm they have $4 beers and half of liquor so that's a plus.

Chocolate chip cookie shake was excellent, the big scorcher burger was cooked perfectly, heat was perfect, meat was slightly pink and juicy. Waited, Johanna, was friendly and informative. I would definitely recommend this place.

My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place when we were looking for Wahlburgers (which is VERY hard to locate) and we were just in need of a good burger. We checked out the menu, which is displayed outside of the restaurant and were drawn in by the different types of burgers they had. We ordered the Americano burger medium and an order or fries and sweet potato fries. It didn't take long to get our food, which was awesome because we were STARVING. The burger was AMAZINGLY cooked and very well seasoned. The sweet potato fries rocked, but I was not a fan of the fries, which was not a total loss because we got them for free for checking in. . Overall, I would return here. I am a local and maybe might try the breakfast sometime after a late night or just go back for the burger. Only four stars because the hostess was not really up to par, but our server was awesome!

Meat baby, meat. 

I walked the Strip looking for lunch. After sitting down in one burger joint and being ignored for 20 minutes it dawned on me that I didn't check my bookmarks in Yelp. Lo, one of my Yelp-amigos had written about Primeburger and I had bookmarked it. A quick look at the map and it was clear that this restaurant was only 1 km away and so WHOSH!, off I go. Well it wasn't really whosh because I kept getting Pokemon alerts and picked up about 25 creatures on the way. 

The walk was worth it. I had the Hawaiian 5-oh burger and at the waitresses recommendation the "Mudslide" alcoholic shake. Add to that the fact that you get a free order of fries by checking in with Yelp and Oh Yeah, I was in burger heaven. 

Service in Primeburger is awesome. Angel and Pricilla took good care of me from beginning to finish. I also noticed the kitchen crew was having a good time which means a lot to me.

Definitely you should all eat here.

My wife and I were in Vegas and decided to try out this restaurant for lunch. We had the cheddar bacon fries and the chicken club. Both of these items were amazing. The staff was extremely friendly and the food was excellent.

Came here on a whim. Oh my! Their burgers are amazing! Hard to finish one by yourself! Their appetizer fries are to die for. We had the bacon-cheddar fries. Serving size is huge and they had amazing flavor. Our service was outstanding. The host, Mason was friendly and knowledgeable. He offered great dining suggestions. Justin provided excellent service as our waiter.  Definitely make this one of your "have to" stops on your next Vegas trip. You definitely get what you pay for and it's worth every dollar.

The portions are huge! Elizabeth, our waitress, was a little absent minded. She said she'd be back with water then drifted by and asked if we'd like some water. So there might be a few staffing issues going on in the new place. We had the oink, squeal, moo burger, the frenchie burger, and bacon cheese fries. Each burger is decadent and overwhelming. It was good. There are more expensive places with better burgers but it was a good first impression.

Loved this place, definitely coming back next time we're in Vegas. Our burgers were so juicy, we got there an hour before closing so had the place all to ourselves. Next time I'm getting the carrot cake, looks amazing.
I was craving a burger at 10pm and headed over here before Tao Lounge! I must say, my belly was satisfied!
Decent burgers, way overpriced. Glad we got the groupon. We split the Oink, Squeal and Moo and the Big Scorcher. That with a soda and an order of Bacon Cheese Fries was about $50

Much smaller space than I expected.  I had a groupon( still available) for 20.00 for 2ppl.  I believe I paid about 10 bucks for it. My wife ordered a regular primeburger, asked for it medium well, but it was served medium.  My cousin and I shared a grilled chicken club.  We asked for the bacon and tomato on the side, we did not get it that way.  My cousin can't eat bacon for religious reasons so we had to have a new sandwich made.  We ordered fries too and they were served cold and soggy.  Had to ask for new fries and those did not come to the table until after we finished our sandwiches.  I asked them to take them off the bill.  My cousin ordered a soda and we ended up paying an additional 5 and change on top of the groupon.  The service was very, very slow.  The chicken was moist and juicy and my wife liked the flavor of her burger.

Amazing Fooods, burgers are amazing , we have ordered the steak as well, it was beyond goooooooood, the place is so cool, cozy, and the service is amazing, great prices for the amount and quality you get! Our server, Mr. Andres was superb and fun! A must to try, bon appetite!
